supporting_spans: Kai-Koumou, who had hitherto controlled himself, trembled with rage, and his countenance was flushed with a fierce exultation.
Glenarvan hesitated, and watched the Maori chief very attentively. "I do not know," said he, after a moment's silence. "Speak," continued Kai-Koumou. "Is your life worth that of our Tohonga?"
reasoning: Contradiction (factual): The character Kai-Koumou does not have a vengeance curse tattooed on his chest by his mother. Instead, he is involved in negotiations with Glenarvan's group to ransom their high priest Tohonga.

analysis.claim_text: Born on New Zealand’s North-island east coast to a Maori war-chief father and a priestess mother skilled in herbs and star-reading, he saw his father ambushed by a British musket squad, the body mutilated, the left ear taken as trophy; his mother tattooed a vengeance curse on his chest with ochre.

sub_claims.text: Born on New Zealand’s North-island east coast to a Maori war-chief father and a priestess mother skilled in herbs and star-reading.
Saw his father ambushed by a British musket squad, the body mutilated, the left ear taken as trophy.
